definition: to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
clapper talk/patter song (in opera) with clapperboard accompaniment
folk theater consisting of recitation accompanied by clapper board rhythm
suona, Chinese shawm (oboe), used in festivals and processions or for military purposes/also written 鎖吶|锁呐/also called 喇叭[la3 ba5]
to get a monkey to perform tricks/to put on a monkey show/to make fun of sb/to tease
(of a performer) to put on a show at an outdoor venue (temple fair, marketplace etc)/(fig.) to enhance sb's reputation/to make a name for oneself
funny man (lead role in comic dialogue 對口相聲|对口相声[dui4 kou3 xiang4 sheng1])/to joke/to play the fool/to provoke laughter
percussion instrument used by street peddlers, barbers etc to attract attention
